name: Blessed Sisters
background:
The Blessed Sisters are an elite force of religious warriors equipped with advanced armour and weaponry, which formed under the guidance of the God-Queen, a humble woman suddenly turned into a symbol of hope and resistance.

The sisterhoods act as mediators and rely on diplomacy rather than ruling through force. This has left them without the power and resources of other factions, dependent instead on an ever fragile web of alliances and donations.
backgroundFull:
The rise of a gene-scientist, known to history as the Founder, to supreme ruler of humanity, resulted in a devastating war that soon engulfed Earth and its colonies. As the war grew more devastating, many survivors began to seek a means to escape. A desperate group of refugees commandeered the Founderâ€™s own flagship in order to escape the conflict, leading a fleet of like-minded survivors. 

The Founder caught the refugee fleet and forced an engagement on the edge of known space. Seeking to recapture his ship, his forces lead a number of boarding attacks on the refugee fleet. The Battle Brothers easily outmatched most refugee forces, until a mysterious young woman began to rally them together, displaying an almost supernatural ability to inspire confidence in her forces and fear in her foes. Together they repelled the initial attack, and some began to hope that they might manage to escape. 

Then, a massive wormhole formed around the fleets. In an instant, both fleets were further damaged and separated by the wormhole. The colony fleet was scattered, but many sought out and followed the mysterious woman, looking out for suitable worlds to settle. Under her command, a makeshift fleet settled a few dispersed worlds where her diplomatic skills allowed them to thrive in relative peace. 

Soon after arriving in Sirius, she began to develop psychic abilities. These abilities drew many acolytes and followers, inspiring many to name her their God-Queen. Fearful of the return of the Battle Brothers, the God-Queen decided to focus on training her own band of hand picked warriors. These became the Blessed Sisters and many of them came to truly believe she was divine.

After she sacrificed herself to kill an Avatar of Lust, worship of the God-Queen spread, and many new orders formed in her honour. These orders are often called on to protect allied worlds as peace-keepers and as arbitrators.  The Blessed Sisters rely on volunteers, supplies and other donations from faithful worlds and followers. 

Many worlds take their help for granted, making donations hard to come by, and forcing their orders to go through long periods of fasting and self-reflection to survive. When all else fails, the orders find themselves forced to turn on those they were seeking to protect, and establish martial law in order to survive.

How will you remain a beacon of hope in this grimdark future?

specialRules.name: Point-Blank Surge
specialRules.description: When this model shoots at enemies within 12", unmodified results of 6 to hit deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Spell Conduit
specialRules.description: Casters within 12" that are from other friendly units may cast spells as if they were in this model's position, and get +1 to casting rolls when doing so.

specialRules.name: Unique
specialRules.description: This unit may only be taken once per army.

specialRules.name: Fast Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game moves +2" when using Advance actions and +4" when using Rush/Charge actions. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Precision Target
specialRules.description: Once per game, during this model's activation, pick one enemy unit within 36" and in line of sight of it, and place X markers on it. Friendly units get +X to hit rolls when attacking it.

specialRules.name: Devout Boost
specialRules.description: If this model has Devout, it deals extra hits on successful unmodified hit results of 5-6 from Devout (instead of only on 6).

specialRules.name: Shielded
specialRules.description: Units where all models have this rule get +1 to defense rolls against hits that are not from spells.

specialRules.name: Increased Shooting Range Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get +6" range when shooting. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Regeneration Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Regeneration. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Devout
specialRules.description: When attacking, unmodified results of 6 to hit deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Fortified Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Fortified. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Devout Boost Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Devout Boost. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Point-Blank Piercing Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Point-Blank Piercing. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Piercing Assault
specialRules.description: This model gets AP(+1) when charging.

specialRules.name: Shred in Melee Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Shred in melee. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Courage Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get +1 to morale test rolls. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Purge
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and against units where most models have Defense 2+ to Defense 4+, this weapon gets AP(+1).

specialRules.name: Casting Debuff
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick up to 4 enemy units within 18" with Caster, which gets -1 to casting rolls once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Caster
specialRules.description: Gets X spell tokens at the start of each round, but canâ€™t hold more than 6 tokens at once. At any point before attacking, spend as many tokens as the spellâ€™s value to try casting one or more spells (only one try per spell). Roll one die, on 4+ resolve the effect on a target in line of sight. Models within 18â€ in line of sight of the casterâ€™s unit may spend any number of spell tokens at the same time before rolling, to give the caster +1/-1 to the roll per token.

specialRules.name: Regeneration
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 5+ it is ignored.

specialRules.name: Fortified
specialRules.description: When units where all models have this rule take hits, those hits count as having AP(-1), to a min. of AP(0).

specialRules.name: Point-Blank Piercing
specialRules.description: This model gets AP(+1) when shooting enemies within 12".

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: Shred
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 1 to block hits, this weapon deals 1 extra wound.

specialRules.name: Ignores Regeneration
specialRules.description: This weapon ignores Regeneration.

specialRules.name: Defense
specialRules.description: This model gets +X to defense rolls.

specialRules.name: Piercing Hunter
specialRules.description: When this model shoots at enemies over 9" away, its weapons get AP(+1).

specialRules.name: Blast
specialRules.description: Ignores cover, and after resolving other special rules, each hit is multiplied by X, where X is up to as many hits as enemy models in the target unit and within 3â€ of it. Hits must be split evenly between all enemy units within 3â€ of any model from the target (defender picks how).
